Belgium: Pope Julius II grants indulgence for those contributing to the rebuilding of the collegiate church of Dinant, equal to the indulgence for a pilgrimage to Rome.
Colombia: Ojeda founded the village of San Sebastián de Urabá
Indigenous princess India Catalina is abducted by Spanish conqueror Diego de Nicuesa from a Calamari indigenous settlement
India: Battle of Diu marks the beginning of the dominance of the Europeans in the Asian naval theater.
Indinesia: The Portuguese king sends Diogo Lopes de Sequeira to find Malacca, the eastern terminus of Asian trade. After initially receiving Sequeira, Sultan Mahmud Syah captures and/or kills several of his men and attempts an assault on the four Portuguese ships, which escape. The Javanese fleet is also destroyed in Malacca.
Vietnam: Lê Tương Dực assassinated his cousin, the tyrant Lê Uy Mục, and replaced him as emperor.
